wikipedia_page.main:
Stephen Stirling (born 5 January 1990) is a Scottish footballer who plays for [Neilston Juniors]
Stirling started his career with Rangers, spending a loan spell at Stirling Albion, before being released and dropping out the senior game for a short time, then returning with Stranraer. He has also had two spells at Greenock Morton.

Morton signed Scotland youth international Jason Naismith on loan from St Mirren. Former Scotland U19 international Stephen Stirling signed a pre-contract to join when his Stranraer contract expired in June.

link_mentions.page: PFA Scotland Team of the Year

response: Nicolas Caraux and Fouad Bachirou signed contract extensions to keep them at the club until the summer of 2015. Joe McKee also extended his contract. Stephen Stirling signed on again on a short-term deal until January 2014.
Craig Reid, Jake Nicholson and Stephen Stirling were told they could leave the club at the end of their short-term contracts.
